meanings.definition: Kinases: enzymes that catalyze the transfer of phosphate groups from high-energy donor molecules to specific substrates.
meanings.sent1: The kinases in our body help transfer energy to different parts.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study kinases to understand how cells communicate with each other.
meanings.sent3: The kinases at the party were passing around energy like a game of hot potato.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted like kinases, transferring motivation from one task to the next.
meanings.sent5: The kinases in the cell were like tiny messengers, delivering energy where it was needed most.

meanings.definition: Kinases: proteins that play a crucial role in cell signaling pathways by regulating various cellular processes.
meanings.sent1: Cell signaling relies on kinases to send important messages within the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are researching how to target specific kinases to treat certain diseases.
meanings.sent3: The kinases in the cell were like traffic controllers, directing signals to the right destinations.
meanings.sent4: In the orchestra of the body, kinases are the conductors, ensuring harmony in cellular activities.
meanings.sent5: Just like a GPS guides a driver, kinases guide cellular processes to their intended outcomes.
